It seems rather atypical of a Soten work. I was rather more interesting in
=
the write up, particularly the fact that almost 95 per cent of Soten pieces=

are Yokohama-mono. I think the collecting public in the States needs to
re=
alize just how much poor quality Yokohama export stuff in terms of
fittings=
 and swords is floating around. A lot of it is very flashing
looking, but n=
o depth of workmanship or artistic level. A lot of newbies get
sucked into =
buying this stuff for far more than it is worth.

 

Gordon
